title: [BUG] Error registering model version: The provided Model Flavors dictionary is invalid [R]

labels.name: area/model-registry
labels.description: Model registry, model registry APIs, and the fluent client calls for model registry

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

1.26.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS
- **R**: R version 4.2.0 (2022-04-22) -- "Vigorous Calisthenics"


### Describe the problem

After training a model, I'm not able to register the model using `mlflow_create_model_version`. Previously, I registered a model using Azure Machine Learning UI.
I tested the code using `mlflow_log_model` and `mlflow_save_model`, to no avail. Using the Azure ML UI, I can click the button "Create model", and then the model is registered just fine. But I can't register it using any mlflow function

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1222398/174620931-38d7a22b-ce1b-4c5b-baef-dcea48862b8a.png)




### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

```R
fit.rf <- train(sex~., data=train, method="rf", metric=metric, trControl=control)
predictor <- crate(function(x) {
  stats::predict(model,x)
}, model = fit.rf)
mlflow_log_model(predictor, "rf_model")

# when train finishes

model_version <- mlflow_create_model_version("penguins_R", paste(run$artifact_uri,"rf_model", sep="/"), run_id=run$run_id) # this lines throwns exception

```

### Other info / logs

```
Error: API request to endpoint 'model-versions/create' failed with error code 400. Reponse body: 'list(Code = "ValidationError", Severity = NULL, Message = "The provided Model Flavors dictionary is invalid. When provided, Flavors must contain a top level python_function key with a loader_module sub-key under it.", MessageFormat = NULL, MessageParameters = NULL, ReferenceCode = NULL, DetailsUri = NULL, Target = NULL, Details = list(), InnerError = NULL, DebugInfo = NULL, AdditionalInfo = NULL); list(operation = "da65ed16af7778f190ff960cb651c432", request = "21bb2e6669415597"); westeurope; westeurope; 2022-06-20T12:28:22.6177048+00:00; mlflow; INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE'
```

- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

- [X] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [X] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
